members.name: Hon. Justice Akintoroye Williams Akinlolu
members.bio:
Hon. Justice Akintoroye Williams Akinlolu is the pioneer Chairman of the Ondo State Public Complaints, Financial Crime and Anti-Corruption Commission. Born in Ondo Local Government (now Ondo West Local Government Council) on the 5th of November, 1957, he graduated from the University of Lagos, obtaining a Bachelor of Laws (LL.B) degree in 1983. He proceeded to the Nigerian Law School, Lagos, and was called to the Bar in 1984.

After completing his mandatory National Youth Service Corps (NYSC), Justice Akintoroye joined the private law firm of Chief Olabisi Akinsiku in Ondo in 1985. He practiced law actively until August 2002, when he was appointed as a High Court Judge. Over his judicial career, he served in various Judicial Divisions of the Ondo State Judiciary, including Okitipupa, Ondo, Oka-Akoko, Owo, and Akure Divisions of the High Court.

In 2004, he was appointed Chairman of the Commission of Enquiry set up by the administration of the late Dr. Olusegun Agagu to investigate contract awards under the administration of Chief Adefarati. He also served as a member of the Borno State Governorship Election Tribunal in 2011. In September 2021, he was appointed Chief Judge of the Ondo State Judiciary by Governor Oluwarotimi Odunayo Akeredolu, SAN (now late). Justice Akintoroye retired from service on the 4th of November, 2022, upon reaching the mandatory retirement age of 65.

As a dedicated, innovative, and committed professional, Justice Akintoroye has worked closely with the pioneering staff of the Commission to establish a strong foundation that will serve as a legacy for future leadership. He is happily married with children.
achievements: Chief Judge of Ondo State Judiciary (2021-2022)

members.name: Prof. Adewole Adeyeye
members.bio:
Professor Adewole Adeyeye is presently the Secretary/Member of Board, Ondo State Public Complaints, Financial Crime and Anti-Corruption Commission (SPFACC). He was born into the family of Chief Asolo of Owo Kingdom on the 15th of June 1963. 

 He attended Imade College Owo, but he eventually finished his secondary education at St Thomas Aquinas College, Akure in 1980. He attended Osogbo Grammar School for his Higher School Certificate (HSC) between 1980 and 1982. He later attended the University of Ibadan for his Bachelors degree in 1983. He did his National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) at Federal College of Education Osiele in 1987. He obtained two Master degrees in Business Administration (M.B.A) in 1991 and M.A. (Applied Ethics) from the University of Ibadan in 1994. 

 He started work at Department of Business studies, Federal Polytechnic Ilaro as a lecturer I. He rose to the rank of Principal lecturer in 2007. He left the polytechnic to establish the Centre for Organisational and Professional Ethics (COPE AFRICA). In 2008, he bagged a doctorate degree (PhD) in Applied Ethics with specialization in International Business Ethics. In 2011, he joined Ondo State University of Science and Technology as a lecturer I and rose through the rank to become a Professor in 2018. 

 He is the pioneer Head of General and Entrepreneurial Studies. Director, Centre for Entrepreneurship and Leadership Training (CELT). He is also the pioneer Dean, School of Management Science (SMS) of Olusegun Agagu University of Science and Technology. 

 His research interests include: Business Ethics, Applied Ethics, Business and Management studies, Ethics of governance, Professional Ethics Anti-Corruption and Compliance. 

 He has over 68 publications to his credit that include refereed journals, conference proceedings, technical reports, edited works and chapter contributions. 

 Professor Adewole Adeyeye is a member of many national and international professional societies (APPE, SBE, DSA, WASBE, BEN-AFRICA), etc. 

 He is a Lead consultant, United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), United Nations Convention against Corruption (UNCAC), United Nation Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC), Zero Corruption Coalition (ZCC). He is a Certified Corruption Risk Assessor (CRA). 

 He developed the Ethics Training manual for the 29 Police Training Schools (PTS) across Nigeria with full sponsorship by the United Nation Office on Drug and Crime (UNODC). He is a Technical Consultant to International Standard Organisations (ISO). He is a Consultant and Vice-Chair, National Mirror committee on ISO by the Standard Organisation of Nigeria (SON). 

 He is the Founder/Executive Director, Centre for Organisational and Professional Ethics (COPE-AFRICA); Co-convener, Ethical practices worldwide, United Kingdom, Regulatory Institution Network (REGNET) Africa-UK/Rwanda, Executive Secretary, West African Society on Business Ethics (WASBE), President, Global Best Educational Advancement Services Limited (GBEAS). 

 He is a member Association of Professional Bodies of Nigeria (APBN), Fellow Ethics Centre, University of Cambridge. 

 He has received various grants from organizations such as Carnegie Mellon, NCDMB. He is a visiting Professor to the University of Ibadan Business School. 

 He is an accredited Due Process Observer by Bureau of Public Procurement (BPP) supervising about seventeen (17) federal government agencies. He is Due process Trainer. 

 Prof Adeyeye is a World Bank accredited contract monitoring expert and Advisor to the Office of the Special Adviser to the President on CSO's. 

 He was the Team Leader, UNODC/ICPC sponsored Constituency Project Tracking and Monitoring Team 2015 – 2019. 

 He was the lead consultant, Oyo State Due Process Audit Team for Ministries, Department and Agencies 2011 to 2019.

members.name: Kemi Akerele, Esq. AICMC
members.bio:
Kemi Akerele currently serves in the legal department of the Commission, having joined in April 2024. She has played a crucial role in the formative stage of the Commission, leveraging her legal expertise to provide advisory support in the best interest of the institution. With her extensive knowledge and experience in court procedures and oath registry, she effectively navigates the complexities of public complaints, financial matters, and corruption investigations.

She holds a Bachelor of Laws (LL.B) degree from Obafemi Awolowo University, Ile-Ife, and was called to the Nigerian Bar over a decade ago. Prior to joining the Commission, she was seconded from the state judiciary, where she served as a Legal Research Officer. Kemi is an Associate Member of the Institute of Chartered Mediators and Conciliators and an active member of the Nigerian Bar Association, Federation of Female Lawyers, and the Nigerian Women Lawyers Forum.
affiliations: Associate Member, Institute of Chartered Mediators and Conciliators

members.name: Okuneye Adewale Gbenga
members.bio:
Okuneye Adewale Gbenga is a seasoned accountant with extensive experience in public finance and auditing. He currently serves as the Director of Accounts at the Ondo State Public Complaints, Financial Crime and Anti-Corruption Commission. His career in the Ondo State Civil Service spans over two decades, during which he has held key positions in financial management and payroll administration.

Born on October 11, 1974, in Ogun State, Nigeria, he began his academic journey at Ifesowapo High School, Imosan, Ijebu, before proceeding to Ilugun Alaro Grammar School, Ilugun. He later obtained a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting (B.Sc) in 2016.

Okuneye started his professional career in the Ministry of Natural Resources, Ondo State, where he worked from 2002 to 2006. He then moved to the Office of the Accountant-General, Ondo State, where he served as a Desk Officer and Payroll Administrator from 2006 to 2021. He later became an Internal Auditor at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (2021-2024) before assuming his current role.

As a member of the Association of National Accountants of Nigeria (ANAN) and the Chartered Institute of Finance and Control (CIFCON), he brings a wealth of knowledge in financial accountability and control to the Commission. He is dedicated to fostering transparency and efficiency in public finance management.

He is happily married and enjoys mentoring young professionals in the field of accounting and finance.
affiliations: Member, Association of National Accountants of Nigeria (ANAN)
Member, Chartered Institute of Finance and Control (CIFCON)

management.name: Pharm. Chief Mrs. Olufunmilayo Olabisi  Osundolire.
management.bio:
Ch. Mrs. Olufunmilayo Olabisi Osundolire, born over six decades ago to Mr. Joshua and Mrs. Rachel Arigbede is a distinguished pharmacist of note by profession and a seasoned technocrat per excellence who retired as a Permanent Secretary in 2017, after the mandatory 35 years period in the services of the Ondo State Government.

She had her early education at St John's Primary School, Ilesa, and her Secondary School education at Queen's School, Ibadan, where she passed out in 1974 with a Grade 1. She attended the then University of Ife, now Obafemi Awolowo University, Ile Ife, for her bachelor's degree in Pharmacy and obtained a B.Pharm. Honors Degree. (1980), and also the same institution for her Master's Degree in Public Administration where she obtained her (MPA), with Distinction in 2003.

Her career path commenced in 1982 when she took up an appointment with the Hospital Management Board of the then Ondo State Government, as a Pharmacist Grade 1 and she was posted to Ado Ekiti State Specialist Hospital, Ado Ekiti. Early in her career in 1985, she was posted to State Specialist Hospital, Ondo, (SSH) as a Senior Pharmacist acting in post as the Head/Director of Pharmacy at the SSH and the then Ondo Medical Zone, in a supervisory capacity superintending over the Pharmacy departments of 1, General Hospital, 2 Comprehensive Health Centers, and 5, Basic Health Centres.

This early experience afforded her the opportunity to cut her teeth in administrative expertise at an early age and stage in her career. It was while working at the State Specialist Hospital, Ondo in the stated capacity, that she rose through the ranks until she was promoted to the post of a substantive Director in the year 2004. In 2007, as a result of her outstanding performance, she was transferred to State Specialist Hospital, Akure, to head the pharmacy department at the State's headquarters and carry out the reform and reorganisation of the department.

Due to her distinguishing herself in her field of practice, she was given an award as the best Pharmacist in the service of Ondo State by the Ministry of Health in 1993.

In 2009, she was appointed as a Permanent Secretary (PS) by the Ondo State Government, through a merit system. This appointment made her emerge as the first pharmacist to be so appointed as a PS in the service of Ondo State.

Between 2009 and 2017 she served as a PS in three different ministries, namely Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Community Development and Cooperative Services and Ministry of Women Affairs. She excelled in her service delivery at these various ministries and made her impact, that has left behind indelible footprints visible to date so much that she was given a commendation letter by the then Head of Service, Barr. Toyin Akinkuotu.

Pharm. Mrs. Funmi Osundolire has attended many conferences both within and outside the country including being Ondo State representative on the Federal Government delegation to the UN's Women Commission, 2016.

She has received many awards both in her professional, Church, Organizations and the Community capacities, including a Merit Award Winner (MAW) of the Pharmaceutical Society of Nigeria, Ondo State Branch, an award of honor from Ile-Oluji Community, a Merit Award by the National Anglican Youth Fellowship of which she was a National officer in 2004 to mention a few. She is a State Patroness of the Boy's Brigade, Nigeria. She holds the chieftaincy title of the 'Iya Ewe' of St. Andrew's Anglican Church, Ondo Diocese, Anglican Communion. She is a Fellow of the Pharmaceutical Society of Nigeria (FPSN) and a Fellow of the Institute of Public Administration of Nigeria (FIPAN).

She is presently a member of the Governing Board of the Office of the Public Defender (OPD), Ondo State and; a Board Member of the newly established Ondo State Public Complaints, Anti-Corruption and Economic and Financial Crime Commission and other Matters (OSPACC).

Ch. Mrs. Funmi Osundolire is the Executive Director of Children in Peril, an NGO, seeing to the welfare of children.

Ch. Mrs. Funmi Osundolire is a humble, humane, quintessential woman of quality and integrity who fears God and has great concerns for humanity. She is a Social Crusader and a strong advocate for human rights and social justice. She is well travelled, loves reading and engaging in intellectual discussions. She is married with beautiful children and grandchildren.
